content.html:
Activity

Write down your answer for how to solve each equation. Find the two solutions by rewriting it in factored form or by completing the square. Be prepared to explain your choice of method.

  1. Select two solutions for \(x^2−2x−1.25=0\).

Correct! 2.5, -0.5

The correct answers are: 2.5, -0.5.

Select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

Completing the square method:

\(\begin{array}{rcl} x^{2}-2 x-1.25 &=&0 \\ x^{2}-2 x &=&1.25 \\ x^{2}-2 x+\left(\frac{-2}{2}\right)^{2} &=&1.25+\left(\frac{-2}{2}\right)^{2} \\ x^{2}-2 x+1 &=&1.25+1 \\ x^{2}-2 x+1 &=&2.25 \\ (x-1)^{2} &=&2.25 \\ \sqrt{(x-1)^{2}} &=&\sqrt{2.25} \\ x-1 &=&\pm \sqrt{2.25} \\ x &=&1 \pm \sqrt{2.25} \\ x &=&1 \pm 1.5 \\ x &=&1+1.5 \\ x &=&1-1.5 \\ x &=&2.5 \\ x &=&-0.5 \\ x&=&2.5 \text { and } x=-0.5 \end{array}\)


  1. Select two solutions for \(5x^2+9x−44=0\).

Correct! 2.2, -4

The correct answers are: 2.2, -4.

Select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

Completing the square method:

\(\begin{array}{rcl} 5 x^{2}+9 x-44 &=&0 \\ 5 x^{2}+9 x &=&44 \\ \frac{5 x^{2}+9 x}{5} &=&\frac{44}{5} \\ x^{2}+\frac{9}{5} x+\left(\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{9}{5}\right)^{2} &=&\frac{44}{5}+\left(\frac{1}{2} \cdot \frac{9}{5}\right)^{2} \\ x^{2}+\frac{9}{5} x+\frac{81}{100} &=&\frac{44}{5}+\frac{81}{100} \\ x^{2}+\frac{9}{5} x+\frac{81}{100} &=&\frac{961}{100} \\ \left(x+\frac{9}{10}\right)^{2} &=&\frac{961}{100} \\ \sqrt{\left(x+\frac{9}{10}\right)^{2}} &=&\sqrt{\frac{961}{100}} \\ x+\frac{9}{10} &=&\pm \frac{31}{10} \\ x &=&-\frac{9}{10} \pm \frac{31}{10} \\ x &=&-\frac{9}{10}+\frac{31}{10} \\ x &=&-\frac{9}{10}-\frac{31}{10} \\ x &=&\frac{22}{10}=2.2\\ x&=&-\frac{40}{10}=-4 \\ x&=&2.2 \text { and } x=-4 \end{array}\)


  1. Select two solutions for \(x^2+1.25x=0.375\).

Correct! 0.25, -1.5

The correct answers are: 0.25, -1.5.

Select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

Completing the square method:

\(\begin{aligned} x^{2}+1.25 x &=0.375 \\ x^{2}+1.25 x+((0.5)(1.25))^{2} &=0.375+((0.5)(1.25)){ }^{2} \\ x^{2}+1.25 x+0.390625 &=0.375+0.390625 \\ (x+0.625)^{2} &=0.765625 \\ \sqrt{(x+0.625)^{2}} &=\sqrt{0.765625} \\ x+0.625 &=\pm 0.875 \\ x &=-0.625 \pm 0.875 \\ x &=-0.625+0.875 \\ x &=-0.625-0.875 \\ x &=0.25 \\ x &=-1.5 \\ x=0.25 & \text { and } x=-1.5 \end{aligned}\)


----------------------------------------
  1. Select two solutions for \(4x^2−28x+29=0\).

Correct! \(\frac{7}{2}+ \sqrt {5}\), \(\frac{7}{2}- \sqrt {5}\)

The correct answers are: \(\frac{7}{2}+ \sqrt {5}\), \(\frac{7}{2}- \sqrt {5}\).

------------------------------------

Select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

Completing the square method:

\(\begin{array}{rcl} 4 x^{2}-28 x+29 &=&0 \\ \frac{4 x^{2}-28 x+29}{4} &=&0 \\ x^{2}-7 x+\frac{29}{4} &=&0 \\ x^{2}-7 x &=&-\frac{29}{4} \\ x^{2}-7 x+\left(\frac{7}{2}\right)^{2} &=&-\frac{29}{4}+\left(\frac{7}{2}\right)^{2} \\ x^{2}-7 x+\frac{49}{4} &=&\frac{20}{4} \\ x^{2}-7 x+\frac{49}{4} &=&5 \\ \left(x-\frac{7}{2}\right)^{2} &=&5 \\ \sqrt{\left(x-\frac{7}{2}\right)^{2}} &=&\sqrt{5} \\ x-\frac{7}{2} &=&\pm \sqrt{5} \\ x&=&\frac{7}{2}\pm\sqrt{5} \\ x&=&\frac{7}{2}+\sqrt{5} \\ x&=&\frac{7}{2}-\sqrt{5} \\ x&=&\frac{7}{2}+\sqrt{5} \text { and } x=\frac{7}{2}-\sqrt{5} \end{array} \)
